math_problem.A4018:
find all the function $f,g:R\rightarrow R$ such that
(1)for every $x,y\in R$  we have  $f(xg(y+1))+y=xf(y)+f(x+g(y))$
(2)$f(0)+g(0)=0$ Instead of finding all functions $f$ and $g$ satisfying the given functional equation and initial condition, simply find $k = b + 2$, where $b$ is the value of $f(0)$ derived from the functional equation and the condition $f(0) + g(0) = 0$.

math_problem.A4052:
Find all functions $f:\mathbb{R} \to \mathbb{R}$ such that for any two real numbers $x,y$ holds
$$f(xf(y)+2y)=f(xy)+xf(y)+f(f(y)).$$

A4018: Mathematics -> Algebra -> Abstract Algebra -> Field Theory
